text: The voiced bilabial stop is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is . The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by "b" as in bear and about. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe /bġ° 'nine' Arabic Standard /baab/bāb 'door' Assyrian ܒܒܐ baba ] 'father' Armenian Eastern /bari 'kind' Basque 'hot' Bengali বলো/balo 'say!' Catalan 'beautiful' Chinese Southern Min 閩/ ban 'Fujian province' Wu 皮/ bi 'skin' Xiang 浮/ baw 'to float' Czech 'boot' Dutch 'farmer' English aback 'aback' Esperanto 'war' Filipino 'bone' French 'mud' Georgian / bavšvi 'child' German 'but' Greek / bócha 'reek' Gujarati /bakri 'goat' Hebrew /báyit 'house' Hindustani Hindi / bāl 'hair' Urdu / bāl Italian 'rage' Japanese / '(one's) turn' Kabardian /bg"uy 'nine' Korean / 'roof' Kurdish Northern 'father' Central /bâwk Southern /bâwig Luxembourgish 'blown' Macedonian /ubav 'beautiful' Malay 'new' Maltese 'threshold' Marathi / baṭāṭā 'potato' Nepali / bāṭo 'path' Norwegian 'bonfire' Odia ବାର/barô 'twelve' Persian / xub 'good' Pirahã 'parent' Polish 'bass' Portuguese 'I strike' Punjabi ਬਿੱਲੀ/billī 'cat' RomanianDEX Online : 'bull' Russian /ryba 'fish' Serbo-Croatian Serbo- Croatian / 'creature' Slovak 'to be' Spanish 'to invest' Swedish 'good' Thai /bam-bàt [bam.bat̚] 'therapy' Turkish 'cloud' Tyap 'to come' Ukrainian / brat 'brother' Welsh mab [mɑːb] 'son' West Frisian 'tray' Yi / 'mountain' Zapotec Tilquiapan bald 'few' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiced bilabial plosive
